comment._content: Grand Duchess Xenia (not Xexia) of Russia (1875-1960): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Duchess_Xenia_Alexandrovna_of...

comment.author: 96179722@N00
comment._content: A little side note. Here's a photo of Xenia and her husband, her 1st cousin once removed, a Russian Grand Duke: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Grand_Duke_Alexander_Mikhailov... I thought it was remarkable that he looked so much like her brother, the Czar (even though they were related): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nicholas_II_of_Russia.jpg And then, take a look at George V, King of England...yet another cousin: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kinggeorgev1928.jpg Unbelievable how strong family genes are. And it makes it hit home for me that all these royal families were related. So wars were nothing more than family squabbles that got lots of people killed.

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: I would guess they are cousins on both sides of the family so probably more like siblings!  and yes how sad they fought.
